item.title: rfordatascience:ä»å…¥é—¨åˆ°å…¥åœŸ_å®è·µç¯‡
item.description:
[mpg.html](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22677446/mpg.html) --- title: 'MPG åˆ†ææŠ¥å‘Š' output: html_document date: '2025-10-03' ---
```{r setup, include=FALSE} knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) library(tidyverse) ```
## R Markdown
This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.
When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
```{r cars} glimpse(mpg) ```
## Inclusion Plots
```{r scatter_plot, echo=TRUE, message=TRUE, warning=TRUE} ggplot(mpg,aes(x = cty, y = hwy, colour = class)) + geom_point() + scale_color_brewer(palette = 'Dark2')
ã€‚

item.title: pythonå­—å…¸ç”¨æ³•çŸ¥å¤šå°‘ï¼Ÿ
item.description:
## 1. å­—å…¸å­˜å‚¨ä»»æ„å¯è°ƒç”¨å¯¹è±¡ï¼ˆCallableï¼‰ å¯ä»¥æ··åˆå­˜å‚¨å„ç§ Callable æ¯”å¦‚ï¼š | åç§° | ä¸¾ä¾‹ä»£ç  | | ---------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | ç±» | class SMSNotifier:
def `__init__`(self, number, message):
self.number = number
self.message = message
def send(self):
print(f'Sending SMS to {self.number}: {self.message}') | | `__call__` | class PushNotification:
def `__call__`(self, user_id, content):
print(f'Sending push to user {user_id}: {content}') | | Lambda è¡¨è¾¾å¼ | log_to_file = lambda message: print(f'Logging to file: {message}') | | æ™®é€šå‡½æ•° | def send_email(to, subject, body):
print(f'Sending email to {to} with subject '{subject}'') | å¯¹ä»¥ä¸Šåˆ›å»ºå­—å…¸ ```python notifiers = { 'email': send_email, # å‡½æ•° 'sms': SMSNotifier, # ç±» 'push': PushNotification(), # å¯è°ƒç”¨å®ä¾‹ 'log': log_to_file, # Lambda 'alert': lambda msg: print(f'ğŸš¨ ALERT: {msg}') # å†…è” Lambda } ``` ç„¶åç”¨å‡½æ•°å¯¼å‡º ```python def notify(method, *args, **kwargs): notifier = notifiers[method] return notifier(*args, **kwargs) notify('email', 'user@example.com', 'Hello', 'This is a test') notify('sms', '+1234567890', 'Hi there!') notify('push', 'user_123', 'You have a new message!') notify('log', 'System started') notify('alert', 'CPU usage high!') ``` å®é™…è¿ç”¨1ï¼šåœ¨æ¸¸æˆè®¾è®¡æŠ€èƒ½å½“ä¸­ï¼Œå¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨å­—å…¸åµŒå¥—å’Œå‡½æ•°å°†æ–‡å­—è¯´æ˜å’Œæ•ˆæœå®ç°ç»‘å®šï¼Œ - å‡½æ•°ä¹Ÿèƒ½â€œå­˜èµ·æ¥â€ï¼šä¸åƒæ•°å­—æˆ–å­—ç¬¦ä¸²ï¼Œå‡½æ•°ï¼ˆåŒ…æ‹¬ lambdaï¼‰æ˜¯å¯ä»¥â€œä¿å­˜â€å’Œâ€œä¼ é€’â€çš„å¯¹è±¡ã€‚

item.title: Nano_banana_prompts
item.description:
# 1.å„è¡¨æƒ…å¤´åƒprompt Character emotions sheet, multiple expressions of the provided character, featuring happy, sad, angry, surprised, shy, confused, playful, disgusted, thoughtful, crying, and embarrassed. Full set of emotions, clear and distinct expressions, clean background
> A cinematic scene inside a fast food restaurant at night. Foreground: a lonely table with {food_items}, and a smartphone shown large and sharp on the table, clearly displaying the uploaded anime/game character image. A hand is reaching for food, symbolizing solitude. Midground: in the blurred background, a couple is sitting together. One of them is represented as a cosplayer version of the uploaded character: -If the uploaded character is humanoid, show accurate cosplay with hairstyle, costume, and signature props. If the uploaded character is non-humanoid (mecha, creature, mascot, etc.), show a gijinka (humanized cosplay interpretation) that carries clear visual cues, costume colors, and props from the reference image (armor pieces, wings, ears, weapon, or iconic accessories). The other person is an ordinary human, and they are showing intimate affection (kissing, holding hands, or sharing food).
Background: large glass windows, blurred neon city lights outside. Mood: melancholic, bittersweet, ironic, cinematic shallow depth of field.
[reference: the uploaded image defines both the smartphone display and the cosplay design, with visible props emphasized]
# 2.ä¸“å±æ‰‹åŠprompt
> Create a photorealistic, highly detailed PVC character figure, meticulously crafted based on a photograph. The figure stands proudly on a sleek, round plastic base. Behind it, its collectible box features a high-quality print of the original character art. Adjacent to the box, a computer monitor displays the intricate 3D modeling process in Blender, showcasing the digital sculpting and texturing. The entire figure is rendered in a clear, translucent PVC material, giving it an ethereal, ghost-like quality. The scene is set within a professional design studio with soft, diffused indoor lighting that highlights the figureâ€™s form and transparency.
# 3.æ¨¡ç‰¹å–å®¶ç§€prompt
> Take the model from [Model image] and dress her in the complete outfit shown in [Clothing]. Place her in a bright, outdoor park setting during a sunny day. Ensure the clothes fit her body realistically, with natural folds and shadows. The modelâ€™s face, hair, and identity must remain consistent.
# 4.ARçœ¼é•œprompt
> Analyze the provided [Scene Image]. Identify the 1-3 most prominent landmarks, buildings, or points of interest. For each identified point, draw a neat, glowing blue outline around its silhouette. Next to each outline, overlay a clean, semi-transparent dark UI box. Inside each box, display plausible information such as a generated Name, Type/Location, and a brief, one-sentence description. The overall style should be modern and informative, like an augmented reality (AR) view.
# 5.3Dç‰ˆæœ¬Logo prompt
> Using the xxx from [Logo Image] as the core subject, redesign it in 5 different styles: 1. Cyberpunk, with neon glows and metallic textures. 2. Steampunk, with gears, brass, and clockwork elements. 3. Minimalist line art. 4. 3D inflatable plastic toy. 5. Traditional Japanese ink wash painting (Sumi-e). Maintain the basic shape and recognizability of the owl.
# 6.äººè„¸ prompt
> Take the person in [Photo of a person]. Please make two subtle changes. First, change her hair color to a light pink. Second, add a pair of modern, black-rimmed glasses to her face. Ensure the changes look natural, with correct lighting, shadows, and reflections. Do not alter her facial features or expression.
# 7.å˜3Dç«‹ç‰Œ
> turn this photo into a character figure. Behind it, place a box with the characterâ€™s image printed on it, and a computer showing the Blender modeling process on its screen. In front of the box, add a round plastic base with the character figure standing on it. Make the PVC material look clear, and set the scene indoors if possible.
ã€‚

item.title: Markdown grammar tutorial
item.description:
# ä¸€çº§æ ‡é¢˜ ## äºŒçº§æ ‡é¢˜ ### ä¸‰çº§æ ‡é¢˜ #### å››çº§æ ‡é¢˜ ##### äº”çº§æ ‡é¢˜ ###### å…­çº§æ ‡é¢˜ ï¼ˆâ€œ#â€åéœ€è¦ç©ºä¸€æ ¼ï¼‰ #è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªæ ‡ç­¾ # æ–‡å­—æ ·å¼ ## åŠ ç²—ï¼š **obisidian** åˆ†åˆ« åœ¨ éœ€è¦åŠ ç²—æ–‡å­—å‰åæ·»åŠ ä¸¤ä¸ªæ˜Ÿå· or é€‰ä¸­æ–‡å­—ç„¶åCtrl+B ## å€¾æ–œï¼š *obisidian* åˆ†åˆ« åœ¨ éœ€è¦åŠ ç²—æ–‡å­—å‰åæ·»åŠ å•ä¸ªæ˜Ÿå· or é€‰ä¸­æ–‡å­—ç„¶åCtrl+I ## é«˜äº®ï¼š ==obisidian== åˆ†åˆ« åœ¨ éœ€è¦åŠ ç²—æ–‡å­—å‰åæ·»åŠ ä¸¤ä¸ªç­‰å· ## ä¸‹åˆ’çº¿ï¼š obisidian ç”¨uæ ‡ç­¾åŒ…ä½æ–‡å­— ## åˆ é™¤çº¿ï¼š ~~obisidian~~ åˆ†åˆ« åœ¨ éœ€è¦åŠ ç²—æ–‡å­—å‰åæ·»åŠ ä¸¤ä¸ªæ³¢æµªå· ## è¶…é“¾æ¥ï¼š ç‹åŠ›å®[ã€Šæˆ‘ä»¬çš„æ­Œã€‹](ã€ã€1080Pã€‘ç‹åŠ›å®2021ç¦åˆ©ç§€ã€Šæˆ‘ä»¬çš„æ­Œã€‹ã€‘ https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1zV411e7id/?share_source=copy_web&vd_source=b4602159fb04925f1f56ddcad61dc50f) é€‰ä¸­æ–‡å­—ç„¶åCtrl+Kå¹¶é™„ä¸Šé“¾æ¥ | æ ·å¼ | è¯­æ³• | å¿«æ·é”® | ç¤ºä¾‹ | | ---------- | ----------- | ------ | --------------- | | **åŠ ç²—** | `**æ–‡å­—**` | Ctrl+B | **Obsidian** | | *å€¾æ–œ* | `*æ–‡å­—*` | Ctrl+I | *Obsidian* | | ==é«˜äº®== | `==æ–‡å­—==` | - | ==Obsidian== | | ä¸‹åˆ’çº¿ | `æ–‡å­—` | - | Obsidian | | ~~åˆ é™¤çº¿~~ | `~~æ–‡å­—~~` | - | ~~Obsidian~~ | # æœ‰åºåˆ—è¡¨ 1. first 2. second 3. third ## ==åºå·å’Œæ–‡å­—ç›´æ¥ä¸€å®šè¦æœ‰space== # æ— åºåˆ—è¡¨ - ajskldj - asjioduqw - dqoiwrufn - aoieurg ## ==å‡å·â€œ-â€å’Œæ–‡å­—ç›´æ¥ä¸€å®šè¦æœ‰space== # ä»»åŠ¡åˆ—è¡¨ - [x] æœªå®Œæˆä»»åŠ¡1 - [ ] æœªå®Œæˆä»»åŠ¡2 ## ==å‡å·â€œ-â€åŠ ä¸­æ‹¬å·â€œ[ ]â€ä¸”ä¸‰ä¸ªç¬¦å·ä¸­é—´ä¸€å®šè¦æœ‰space== ### **ä»¥ä¸Šä¸‰ç§åˆ—è¡¨éƒ½å¯ä»¥ä½¿ç”¨==Tab==å®ç°ç¼©è¿›ï¼Œä»¥åŠ==Shiftï¼‹Tab==å–æ¶ˆç¼©è¿›** # å¼•ç”¨ > quote > This is a quote. > You just need to add symbol '>' at every line to achieve your quote. # Callout å¼•ç”¨ > [!danger] Dangerous behavior ! > [!attention] > [!tip] > [!note] > [!abstract] > [!example] > [!question] # é“¾æ¥ # è·³è½¬é“¾æ¥ ä¸¤ä¸ªå·¦ä¸­æ‹¬å· [[Welcome]] [[Welcome]]|[[create a link]] ## åµŒå…¥é“¾æ¥ åœ¨è·³è½¬é“¾æ¥å‰åŠ æ„Ÿå¹å·å³å¯ ![[Welcome]] # å…¶ä»–æ ·å¼ ## è„šæ³¨ [^1] [^1]: æ˜¯çš„ **æ–¹æ‹¬å·åŠ ^ç¬¦å·** ## åˆ†å‰²çº¿ è¿™æ˜¯æ™®é€šå†…å®¹ --- ##### æœ€å¥½è¦åœ¨æ™®é€šå†…å®¹å==å†ç©ºä¸€è¡Œ==ï¼Œå¦åˆ™è¯†åˆ«ä¸ºæ ‡é¢˜ ## ä»£ç å— ``` n=eval(input()) a=1 b=1 c=1 print(a) print(b) for i in range(1,n): c = a + b a = b b = c print(c) ``` ä½¿ç”¨ç¬¦å·é”®ç›˜å·¦ä¸ŠEscä¸‹æ–¹çš„æŒ‰é”®è¿ç»­ä¸‰æ¬¡ï¼Œä½ç½®åˆ†åˆ«åœ¨ä»£ç å—çš„ä¸Šä¸‹ --- ### Markdown è¡¨æ ¼åˆ›å»ºæŠ€å·§ #### 1. **åŸºç¡€ç»“æ„** ```markdown | è¡¨å¤´1 | è¡¨å¤´2 | |---------|---------| | å†…å®¹A | å†…å®¹B | ``` - ç¬¬ä¸€è¡Œå®šä¹‰è¡¨å¤´ - ç¬¬äºŒè¡Œç”¨ `|---|` åˆ†éš”è¡¨å¤´å’Œå†…å®¹ - ä»ç¬¬ä¸‰è¡Œå¼€å§‹å†™å®é™…å†…å®¹ #### 2. **å¯¹é½æ§åˆ¶** ```markdown | å·¦å¯¹é½ | å±…ä¸­å¯¹é½ | å³å¯¹é½ | |:------------|:-----------:|------------:| | æ–‡æœ¬ | æ–‡æœ¬ | æ–‡æœ¬ | ``` - `:---` å·¦å¯¹é½ - `:---:` å±…ä¸­å¯¹é½ - `---:` å³å¯¹é½ #### 3. **å†…å®¹æ’ç‰ˆæŠ€å·§** - **ç‰¹æ®Šå­—ç¬¦å¤„ç†**ï¼š ```markdown | æ˜¾ç¤º \| ç¬¦å· | ä½¿ç”¨ `\|` è½¬ä¹‰ | ``` - **å¤šè¡Œå†…å®¹**ï¼š ```markdown | å•å…ƒæ ¼1 |
å•å…ƒæ ¼2
ç¬¬äºŒè¡Œå†…å®¹
| ``` - **åµŒå…¥æ ·å¼**ï¼š ```markdown | æ ·å¼ | ç¤ºä¾‹ | |------|------| | é¢œè‰² | çº¢è‰²æ–‡å­— | ``` # Ctrlï¼‹E åˆ‡æ¢ç¼–è¾‘å’Œé˜…è¯»æ¨¡å¼ --- # é¢œè‰²ç¼–è¾‘ ï¼ˆç±»ä¼¼CSSï¼‰ ```markdown çº¢è‰²æ–‡å­— ç»¿è‰²æ–‡å­— é»„åº•é»‘å­— æˆ‘æ˜¯çº¢è‰² ``` ### **ä»¥ä¸‹ä¸ºæ•ˆæœï¼š** çº¢è‰²æ–‡å­— ç»¿è‰²æ–‡å­— é»„åº•é»‘å­— æˆ‘æ˜¯çº¢è‰² ã€‚
